Entry.1: It was a cloudy morning; but the sun came out occasionally throout the day we are on the move any day now perhaps to-morrow. heard to-night that we are to move in the morning. things quite —
Entry.2:
It was a cloudy morning. we left here about 8 O'C and marched via Strazeele& Meteren. we billeted about a Kilo & half the other side of last placewe route the billets we were in, when we were here last year. it is much the same round here, as it was then, but perhaps not quite so much traffic, we expect to be on the go again to-morrow, & to do a longer stage, we did not come more than 7M's to day & got here about½ past 11 O'C. Meterenthe last village we passed th
ro
at the church that we passed & left on our right. is where an english lad won his V.C. the church was a nest of MG's& he bombed the lot, this of course was the advanced huns at the time of their first onslaught, —*) remainder of the day quite.
Entry.3: It was raining first thing this morning & rained a good deal during the night the guns were fairly constant up till as late last night, we left these billets today at¼ to 1 O'C and got here Ottawa Camp after a good long march at 25 to 7 O'C we left on our left. we were here last year, or near here, at Dominion Camp. this camp is only about 500 yds from here
Entry.4: It was cloudy this morning but fine, fritz was buisy with a big gun last night. he was shelling Poperingeby the sound of it. our Aroplanes are buisy here. remainder of day quite
Entry.5:
It was a lovely morning the B—n left this camp at 7 O'C this morning we went to the 1
st
A.O.C for two men got back to Ottawa Camp & had dinner then came on here. huts near Dickebushe fritz were over today and dropped some bombs—*
Entry.6: It was very windy and cloudy this morning. expect to leave here for the line to-night fritz was over early this morning & dropped a few bombs
Entry.7:
Another cloudy morning still in same camp guns were constant last night and early this morning. our guns opened a heavy barrage to night at 8.O'C and continued for about an h
r
.
Entry.8:
It was fine first thing this morning. left here for the trenches about 4.O'C 

and went to the huts about an h
rs
walk from the place we left, Dickebushe Camp here we stopped untill it was dark. the traffic here is very buisy. 

19.9.17 We got here about 3 O'C this morning. about an h
r
after our arrival the heaviest bombardment Ive heard opened up this was for the advance. it in intensity for about 2 hrsthen it slackened down. it was then that we moved up into supports —* here wedug in. in the trench that the tommys went over from—*. again this evening the arttly opened and I was while it lasted the attack was a success -
Entry.9:
Still in supportsor the b—n is. we are just behind them again & too near some M.G. posts & line of communication which is to attract a lot of fritz 5.9s his shelling was a bit constant to-day & we had some pretty close to us here. he as got usunder observation here alright for we find a MG sniping at us now, but we do not give him much to snipe at

we have had 3 or 4 right close to us. done water fatigue from Clapham junction to H.Q. this evening the arty fire is still constant.
Entry.10: We are now in an old captured hun block house, the b - n are in the front line, fritz had a good possy here but had to give it up, dead --* arty still going we got some quite close to us here and he chased me from the post, but I went more to the left of the block house for observation, in front of us there are some big villge and I think he gets some of his observation from there -
Entry.11: The weather has been fine but it was a bit windy. Done the usual last night, he has been shelling fairly constant during the day got K at 705 as I was due to releive him ----* our arty is still pouring it into fritz
Entry.12: Another fine day we stopped at half way house fritz bombed here yesterday and got 30 & K & W. left here about 11 O'C this morning I got back to Dickebuckcamp with fire still constant.
Entry.13: It was a fine morning we left here at ½ past 9 O'C this morning and got back to Ottawa Camp about an hr march got Pd when we got here. move off again in the morning
Entry.14:
It was a lovely morning. we had a quiet night moved from here about 8 O'C this morning had a long

ride in motor cars to within a couple of M's of Steenwoorde. here we are in billets which are. we done P&L last night. do not expect to be here long
Entry.15: It was cloudy this morning. had experience last night re chap 4thB--n & -----* re roads etc ---* aeroplanes & signals ---* nothing else doing
Entry.16: It was a lovely morning our aeroplanes were very buisy last night. continued fine & throout the day. G.T. came back to-day -- remainder of day quite.
Entry.17: Another fine day. our aeroplanes were very buisy again last night. fritz was across dropping bombs. V & S.T. ---n went to the 1st A.D. today. remainder of day quite.
Entry.18: It was cloudy this morning. went with the V to Steenwoorde to bring a back from the A.P.M.. we expect to move up to line to-morrow. our aeroplanes were buisy last night. fritz was over and dropped some bombs. fritz was over to-day but he was high up. Steenwoorde is a dirty town, there is a lot of traffic the thro it. expect to move to-morrow.
Entry.19: It was a fine morning. fritz done a lot of bombing last night. some of our B---de have moved up to the line. went on Ch Pde this morning. left the billets to-day about½ p 2 O'C & came here in M.L. we are now ready to move up to the line to-morrow night.
Entry.20:
fritz was very buisy last night & dropped a good many bombs, some were handy. move from here to-night for the firing line. Arty fire opened out very strong first thing this morning. heard

 

later that fritz attacked but was driven back. Done the usual last night.
Entry.21: Another fine morning. fritz was over again last night.
Entry.22: Now at A - Z ridge & we attack tomorrow morning.
Entry.23: Attacked at dawn this morning it was a success, fritz got caught napping.--- *
Entry.25: Still heavy shelling on both sides, fritz made desperate C. Attack but got driven back ---- *
Entry.26: It still continues fine & the arty is still heavy ---- *
Entry.27: Things are not quite to bad now as regards arty fire, the weather is threatening we expect to go out tonight.
Entry.28: It rained a good deal last night and we had a wet trip out stopped at Dickebuschhuts last night.
Entry.29: Got here last night from Dickebusch, we are in tents near Poperinge. the weather is unsettled
Entry.30: It was fine today got pd this morning, we do not know how long we are likely to be here, remainder of day quiet.
Entry.31: It rained a lot last night and continued showering thru the day, hear that the frenchies have made a good move, and also that we have made another good move, still rains. Our + went to B - yto-night
Entry.32: It was a rough night it rained heavy first thing this morning. There is plenty of mud now & things are very sloppy. hear that we are likely to be here a few days yet. ---
Entry.33: It rained a good deal last night and was very cloudy this morning and continued to thro out the day. Went to the 1st A-C.D.G. today with - Ch Pde was held this morning our V went away this morning to a rear camp, fritz was over bombing tonight, but did not get close
Entry.34: It was a very cold night I was cold first thing this morning, but the day was fine. fritz was over again tonight.
Entry.35: Left Steenvorde camp to-day and arrived here in M.L. this camp is near Dick.B. Camp is where we were a few days ago, expect to be here about 12 days, it rained some today.
Entry.36: Went to the line today on fatigue it was fine during day, rode up in L.A. RLy but missed coming back * it rained a good deal this evening, donePGKT two gothas were brought down to-day near here, we went well on the left of were we were last time.
Entry.37:
It was a fine morning. Arty fire was heavy early this morning. some of the Coy went on fatigue to-day. 
​
we done fatigue here in H.L.
Entry.38: Went to lines to-day on fatigue arty fire fairly constant got back about 4 O'C gothasover to-night bombing.
Entry.39: Went on fatigue to-day to lines. Shelling was fairly constant got back to camp about 4 O'C.
Entry.40: Stopped at camp to-day, but Coywent as usual to lines on fatigue. Ch Pde was held this morning. gothas were over to-night.
Entry.41: Went today to the line on fatigue, shelling constant, some close. gothas over again. Some of the bombs dropped were close.
Entry.42: We went on fatigue this morning at 3 o'c. and got back to camp for dinner. Shelling was heavy on the right of where we were working.
Entry.43: On fat again shelling constant. 16 Canadians K & W today, fritz was over tonight.
Entry.44: On fat to-day at Gully. Our B-n had 4 casualties, 3 K & 1 W. fritz was over tonight again and dropped some bombs. some were close. very windy all day.
Entry.45: It rained alot last night it was raining a treat this morning. Went again to the line on fat There was an advance this morning fritz was over again tonight it was a very wet day.
Entry.46: It was fine this morning, but rained some during the night. went on fatagain today had a fair day, one Wd. fritz was right over us & dropped some bombs he also shelled a Bty a treat on our right. Fritz was over tonight & dropped some bombs. They were close. 2nd Bn had between 40 & 50. 10 K remainder Wd some seriously. There were some Tommys K and W too.-----*
Entry.47:
Was up at 3 thirty this morning, and went to the line on fatigue shelling was constant, but we had none close to us. going in our artywas heavy on the right. and later on

 

the left, fritz was over again tonight the deaths in the bombing raid the other night have risen to 13 K.
Entry.48: It was a fine morning, stopped at the camp today but some of our coy went on fat to the line, hear now that the battalion had 4 causalities yesterday 1 K.remainder W. fritz was over this morning & dropped some bombs, but they were a long way off went to the line on fat, left camp at 7 O'C. got Hell. but it was a dud---- got back to camp at 11 O' C. fritz done a lot of bombing tonight but nothing close to our camp,
Entry.49: It was a very cold morning, arty fire very constant on our front, it is now rumoured that the I---ns have lost 60,000 prs and 500guns done fat this afternoon and went to the line on fat tonight, but it was a dud, re night fat and the next day----* it was a cold and wet day thro-out & continued on during the night.
Entry.50: It was a lovely morning some of our coy went to the line on fat we hear now that we are likely to move to the linetomorrow. See by the paper that the It---ns are still getting pushed back the huns capturing 100,000 prs and 700 guns 8 of our b--n fat party wounded to-day with bombs. There were 10 Gothas up. went on fat this afternoon, fritz done a lot of bombing last night and some of the bombs were close
Entry.51: It turned out fine today we left our old camp in the huts this morning & came here Ypres Canal dugouts, we expect to be here till about the 7th of this month & then go into the line, itcame over cloudy this evening and the night was quiet.
Entry.52: It was cloudy first thing this morning and a misty rain, we expect to go up to the trenches, to-morrow, hear that the I - n, tale is only a rumour. it continued a dull day thro out, hear now that we will not move from here for a day or two yet.
Entry.53: It was again misty, we expect to move from here about Monday, hear now that the tale about the I - n is partly right and the british have captured 50,000 turks and a great many guns. It remains quite thro the day.
Entry.54: It was very misty this morning. our arty opened fire about 4 thirty this morning, on a big front and continued heavy for a couple of hrs. hear that the Tommys made an attack. our O'C. and 6 or 7 others left here at 5 O'C this morning for the line. We heard a rumour this morning that the huns had broken thro our lines between Arras and Armentiers but have heard nothing further yet.
Entry.55:
We got up early and left for the line about ¼ past 8 O'C this morning, had a fair trip in, it was misty, we are now in supports, shelling is usual.

 

Went on fatto night
Entry.56: It was cloudy again this morning we done our dug out up last night. there is a heavy bombardment on now, at time 8 O'C Ca----ns went over on our left, came thro yesterday. 12 O'C. Fritz is shelling a little now, our guns are still constant and have been for 6 hrs, the arty fire continued fairly constant thro the day & at 4 OC our guns put up a big barrage. fritz got a few close to us last night. it rained some during the day
Entry.57: It is a dirty morning & it is raining 10.O'C arty fire usual, hear that the C-nsgot all their objectives & captured 1,000 unwounded prs.one of our limbers was blown up this morning, but do not know if any one was hurt. our aeroplanes were very busy this morning, done fat to dumps this evening ---- * our guns put a big barrage over about dusk. we had a fairly quite night.
Entry.58: It was fine this morning went on fatto 2nd Bat about 1 M from here, seen a lot of Can - dins K and W being brought in, aroplanes are active, we have been warned to be ready to move from here at 3 thirty this afternoon Arty active on our left.
Entry.59: We are in a pill-box here. came here last night, went to the line on foot early this morning, there was some barriagejust as we got back 2 of p12were hit 1 K and 1 W. it was a wetday. the arty fire is still active
Entry.60: It was a cloudy morning, we were up at 1 thirty this morning, and went on foot to the firing line and out posts. while I was here M.G --- * it was a lucky morning. it came on to rain later on during the day, we get relieved to-night our arty fire was heavy this morning, and also this evening. it rained very heavy about 4 O.C.
Entry.61: It was cloudy this morning, came out of the trenches last night and had a rough trip --- * we camped at the same dug out Y -s C - l that we were in when we left for the trenches, fritz was over this morning bombing and he shelled close handy with his H.V.G. we left the C --l dug outs for this camp about 10 OC this morning, an after a fair walk arrived here about dinner time, it has been showery to-day, we expect to move from here to-morrow.
Entry.62: It was a lovely morning fritz was over last night bombing but not close. G - l B - d was here this morning. we move from here tomorrow rumour says per (boot?),
Entry.63:
We arrived here at about 1 thirty today left the other camp about ¼ to 10 O'C, we are here in a billet and the mud about here is nearly as bad as it was up the line, we walked about 8 to 9 Ms & move on again to-morrow when we expect to walk 15 Ms. the arty fire

 

on the front has been very heavy & since early this morning, and we hear that the hun have counter attacked several times.
Entry.64: Another route march to-day, it was a fair march. we are beginning to get away from the guns now -
Entry.65: It was a fine day we had a long lead to-day about 12 M and we were glad when we arrived here, we are billeted here in a barn. just hear the guns from here.
Entry.66: It was a fine day, we got here after about 8 Msof a march it was a good road all the way, we are camped herein a big old paper fctry, which to all appearances has not been used for some considerable time, can still hear the sound of guns.
Entry.67: It was cloudy to-day we spell here for to-day - read in the paper to-day of the hun advance on France. we hear different rumours as to where we will end up after our march, we have yet another 2 days marching to do - according to all accounts.
Entry.68: We had a good march today and got here about 2 thirty this afternoon. we done about 10 MS. we came thro some fine country to-day, this is quite a little village we expect to get to our desternation tomorrow near Bolougne.
Entry.69: It was cloudy this morning we had the longest march of all to-day about 15M had a good rd all the way. we had dinner on the outskirts of Semer about 4½ MS from here. it is a big town, we left on our right today a bigplace. Deserves - * got here about 4 thirty this afternoon, there is no village here, but a few scattered farms the village is further on we expect to be here for about 4 WS.
Entry.70: We had a quite day to-day.
Entry.71: It was cloudy to day another quite day.
Entry.72: It is still cloudy weather, we had about 1 hrs pde this morning, we do not expect to do much here till monday, could hear guns a long way off to-night, probably some of the
Entry.73: Another cloudy day, done about 1 hrs pde this morning heard that a big advance has been made betweenSt Q --- & C --- ri a deapth of 16M. it turned out sunny at intervals during the day, this was a surprise both as regards a little comfort and the expectations for this time of the year. looking thro records, have heard or seen nothing more re advance at St Q--- n and C ---ri
Entry.74: It was very windy and dirty this morning. we are not doing much sport an hr or so of a pde in the morning.
Entry.75: It was very windy to-day. went to Ch Pde this morning Bee -- y went to S--- l to-day.
Entry.76: It was a lovely morning but very cold. had games this morning etc. expect to go on the real thing to-morrow, heard guns quite plain to-night. heard later that it was fritz over, bombing Bo--gne probably.
Entry.77: It was a wet morning and rained almost continually during the night. was on billet grd last night. B --- n. pde was cancelled this morning.
Entry.78: It was quite during the day and rained off & on all day.
Entry.79: We are now in new billets about 3 Kilos from the last one's the name of this little village is -
Entry.80: It was fine today got pd today.
Entry.81: it was fine today otherwise quite.
Entry.82: It was cold this morning. Chr Pde was held football match in the afternoon 3 B -- n O'sv 2nd B --n 3rd won 14 to nil.
Entry.83:
Pde this morning football match this afternoon. G Coy 3rd v B Coy 3rd



 

won after a good match by B.Coy 3 pts to nil.
Entry.84: It was a lovely morning this morning was on billet gd last night hear of a good resistance made by the british atC ----- i
Entry.85: A quite day the name of this place is Le Turne
Entry.86: It was a fine day, quite.
Entry.87: It was showery during the day and quite
Entry.88: It was a dull morning D.Coy beat B Coy to-day for the final of the football 3 pts to nil
Entry.89: I was a dull morning,Ch Pde this morning, hear that we are to move to the forward area sometime next week.
Entry.90: It was a very cold morning we went on a route march B.O first thing, and finished up with a Coy in attack. continued cold thro out the day.
Entry.91: It was another cold morning. we went for a good route M with full pck. football in the afternoon.
Entry.92: It was fine this morning. B - n sports were held on the B - n Pde grd a football match was held this afternoon 3rd B - n vO of
Entry.93:
B - n won by the ptes 11 to 3 pts.

13.12 17 It was a fine morning & continued so thro out the Os again played the men

 

and were beaten again 8 to nil. we move from here tomorrow morning.
Entry.94: It was misty rain this morning, we left the Le turne about 9.30 this morning & arrived here about 2 O'C after a pretty stiff march of about 10 miles. we expect to move on to-morrow.
Entry.95: It was a lovely morning, left here at 9 O'C and got here after a good march of 10 M's at 1.20 the name of this place a small village Seninghem. we expect to go on to-morrow, and expect to be in the trenches soon, on the Armentiers front. we passed thro some nice country today. it reminded me much of the country we passed thro after the evacuation of the huns on the Somme last year, a scope of country between Bapaume and the Chateau below Hermis, resembles very much some of the country we passed thro today quite night.
Entry.96: It was a fine day we had a good march, got here about 1 O'C in (paper factory) on our way out. we expect to move early to-morrow morning re fire is to-day -----* after dinner that is tea we cleaned up. came today between 10 & 11 Ms. we move early in the morning.
Entry.97:
We left the facotry early this morning 3.30 and walked

 

about 5½ M's to a town called this is a fairly big place, here we entrained and came via Hazelbruck Baieluille. we detrained at a place called and marched tothis camp 3 M's were we arrived about 1.30 this afternoon, we are now on the front this is well to the right of Pachendale where we last were. we expect to be in this camp about 16 days when we expect to go into the line, we are once again well within range of fritz. the guns are fairly constant. the heavies. of course we hear the usual heavy bombardments but I fancy these are more on the front. that we were last were. we are camped in huts here, hear that the front we are going on to this time is very quite. I was M.O. today. ----*
Entry.98: It was very cold this morning, we had a good run last night with M'O's ----* had a pde for about ½ an hr this morning. quite day a fritz machine was over today
Entry.99:
It was a nice clear morning but it was very cold. went for a route march first thing then had some rifle shooting: the guns on this front are not near as constant as on Pas---dale front, we expect

 

to be here for some time, the name of this camp is the camp across the Rd is named we got Pde to-day.
Entry.100: It was a very cloudy morning this morning, went for a march again this morning. things are very quite. we expect to be here for Xmas day.
Entry.101: It was very cloudy this morning, we went to the line on fatigue to-day. we were within 3 Kilos of the front line, working near the church on the main Mess---es ridge the big Hospice is just across from the old ruins ----* the front here is very the quietest we have been on----* the name of the hamlet is
Entry.102: It was a lovely morning we went on a route march this morning. the Brgde G ---l paid us a visit in the huts this morning. their were a few aeroplanes up this morning
Entry.103: It was very cold this morning. Ch Pde was held in the rec Hall. It was quite all day.
Entry.104:
We went on fatigue again today, we ended up at the same place. Xmas eve is being kept up as well as could be expected

It was raining first thing this morning -- & then it poured later in the day. the front is very quite. we expect to move from here to the linethe later end of the week. Mt Kemmel at the back of us. I am told is the highest pt in Flanders, it belonged to the Mayor of Ypres. he also owned the big chateau in the village of Kemmel. this village is just at the back of our camp. there are a lot of old trenches about here and on the whole most of them are in good condition, there are also some good pill boxes. MG posies, the buildings here have not been shelledmuch it was brobably---* etc ---* our Mjr visited us this morning and wished us the seasons greetings.
Entry.105: We had a very fair day considering the conditions were quite as regards arty fire etc.
Entry.106: today it was cold, a cold piercing wind during the biggest part of the day.
Entry.107: It was a cold morning the front was quite to-day.
Entry.108:
We were up on fatigue to-day , he started shelling near us to-day and keeped

up all the time we were there and got some of them quite close enough. I was sitting down -----*
Entry.109: It was a nice fine morning, we went on a route march and done some salvaging) this afternoon, a fritz plane was right over us this afternoon must have been lost ---*
Entry.110: It was very cloudy this morning then came up very foggy. There is plenty of snow on the ground just now, expect to go to the trenches to-morrow.
Entry.111: - We left here this evening for the line.
Entry.112: We are now in the supports, they are wet and the D.Outs are rather small the front seems quite, but there seems to be plenty of M.G fire.
Entry.113: We are still in supports went on fatigue last night.
Entry.114: Still in supports, went on G.G last night. It has been quite here so far, just an odd shell or two. fine weather prevails
Entry.115: We moved up here last night and are now in the picket lines or out posts, these are not far out in front of the firing line, we had a long night, and it was cold, saw nothing of fritz.
Entry.116: Still in the out posts had a better night last night, not so long on. it was quite, but the MGs are pretty buisy, it was cold.
Entry.117: Still in O.P. got a liven up last night for about 15 minutes otherwise quite, but still cold.
Entry.118: We move from here to night for supports again, it is quite, but cold.
Entry.120: We are still in supports but move back to reserves to-night.
Entry.121: We are now in reserves, it still remains cold.
Entry.123: Went on fatigue yesterday evening, quite.
Entry.124: It was cold first thing this morning but turned out fine later went on fat again last night.
Entry.125: It was fine and also quite to-day, got warned to get ready for my leave just before dinner and left the boys at 3 thirty this afternoon to go to Blighty
Entry.126:
Camped at transport last night it was cold, and caught train Baieullé for Boulogne at 11.30 passed thro Hazebruck - St Omer and Watten, got to Boulogne. We got here about

midnight and billeted in a big building here
Entry.127: left Boulogne about 2 O.C after a good trip across the channel and a nice run from southampton by rail we got into London about 5.30 this evening it is fine weather, a wonder for this time of the year.
Entry.128:
There is not much to record - between this date and the time I arrived back from England, only that we done a piquet in Baiulle for about 14 days, the then went back to the battalion things just took their ordinary course, fatigues, grds, and parade ground work, the battalion was out of the firing line when I joined them up after leave at a place called Weteren, we were here before and when we first came to france we were here too when we first came to France, we moved up here a day or two ago, and are now in the reserves between Paschendale and our last line we left - Messines, there are a few of us here in the tunnels at work. this is another one of our old trenches for we were here in 1916 once in here, and

at the Bluff this is further down on our right, we are now under hill 58the famous hill 60 or what is left of it is just a little way along from us here this is a quite front so far, but there is a bit more shelling than there was on the Messines front our own guns are the busiest. It was a fine day today, we expect to be here for some time.
Entry.129: It was a lovely morning, fritz was shelling a bit today. both gas & shells and wizz-bangs. and a bigger shell down near the guns that are not far from here.
Entry.130: Another fine morning, some of the fatigue party had casulaties last night 2K and some W while on the fatigue. had a visit from Ned and Frank last night we hear that fritz is retreating off this frontbut I do not believe it.
Entry.131: It was a lovely day things were fairly quite, were buisy. a heavy bombardment opened out about 5-O'C this evening and it is reported that fritz attacked on the Menin Rd front, but came proverbial. we got some gas also and had to put our helmets on -
Entry.132:
It was another lovely day and fritz gave this place

some shelling to-day it was mostly heavy stuff. 9.2 & 12 in stuff, btys he is after, but he did no good & as far as we know he got no one excepting one man that he W when he lobded one close at the mouth of our dug out. the shells as they fell used to make this place rock. later on in the evening he sent gas shells over and we got a wiff of some, but nothing came of it, he we are in a dug out which runs under hill 58 from the cutting of the Lille railway or what is left of it. we got Pd to-day, and had to go along the old duck boards some distance, to the A.G. dug-out to get it. it was at the double righ enough, for we had to time fritz with his wonkers.
Entry.133: It was a lovely morning again. things turned out quite after mid-night last night, the
Entry.134:
battalion changed over today. all ourD's are on this front so we are told. this points to an attack. fritz this afternoon started shelling our quarter with his heavies, he was also sending over those pets of his 5.9s with one of these early this afternoon he got some of our chaps ---* it is now very quite on this sector excepting

for a few of our own guns now and again, but the arty fire is heavy away on our left, it is now 2.30 in the morning and I go off at 3 O'C.
Entry.135: It was a fine day. the shelling again to-day was fairly brisk. he sent some very close to the mouth of our dug out one was K and a couple W just before ten. this sector gets it pretty rough when he starts. remainder of day quite.
Entry.136:
It was raining this morning, but from the last entry I made up till this morning it has been glorious weather, there has not been much doing, occasionally he gets nasty and sends over shells enough which make us keep our heads down,

last sunday night
Entry.137:
he sent over some gas and we got a little dose of it before we got our helmets on, mustard gas of it was it affected our eyes a little & and some of us got it worse ---* T.O'N and I got some too the night before when we went down to Spoil we did not notice it at the time but when we got back here, they told us our eyes were blood shot and swolen, so we put it down to gas shells

We are still on our job. this place is the home of gas.this is where fritzgot the Canadianswith gas, our artyletout abombardment at ½past 2 last night and it lasted for ofan hour, we hear that they sent a lot of gasshells over. we hear nowthat we are in this front for sixty days instead of 42 as we expected to be at first.we heard a rumourthat the Dvy to the present has had between 700 & 800 casualties, mostly caused by gas. the hunsare expected to attack ofcourse there hasbeen the usualraids on both sides, the mostof themhave been successful. so far as we can learn, there is a rumourgoing the rounds that 80 of the original men are going to Aussy next month. The arty fire has been heavy attimes along the Ypres - CominesCanal which is first over on rear right.
Entry.138: It was raining to-day the arty fire was fairly active.
Entry.139: It was quite to-day and was fine
Entry.140:
It was fine the shelling to-day was fairly constant and a lot of gas

was sent over.
Entry.141: It was fine this morning fritz sent over a heavy barriagestarting about ½ past this morning, it was extra severe intermingled with gas 177of the 4th Batt got gassed some pretty bad, we got it in the tunnels bad, got releived from the tunnels to-day and go upto the line to-morrow.
Entry.142: It was quite last night. It was a lovely day. we expect to go intoto the reservesto-night.
Entry.143: We are now in reserveshaving got here yesterday afternoon ---* It was a lovely day went on fat , and was on again to day - and also done G. and A guarde shelling has not been too bad.
Entry.144:
It was another lovely day, there are a lot of wild roumours afloatas regards the french, the germansitisreported have lost hevely, french have taken27.000 prs , but nothing seemsto be official. it is also reported that the enemy have Bullecourt back again and are right back to Vaux, if this is true it is hard to take ---*

24.3.18 It turned out a cloudy day and looks like rain this time, we hear that fritz is down about Fig --Thloy on a 4 M front. we expect to move from here to-day - but cannot find out for certain, where we are likely to go. some say

Somme while there is another roumour that we are going onto the front. this is on our right, and we were there not so long ago, fritz has been fairly quite . I ment to mention about a B fat that I went in the night before last so do so here it is worth recording ---* 
R.Light
 We hear that we are not to be out long, for we expect to be in the front line by to-morrow night.
Entry.145: It looks very much like rain. things re fairly quite. we have a dogwith us now he came over from fritz line. I think he is a red dog.
Entry.146: Came here to-day this is a O.C we are likely to be here for a few days the weather is nice and bright.
Entry.147: fritz has cleared this place out. Kemmelthere were a lot of troops here the last time we were here the weather still continues fine.
Entry.148: It was a lovely day, we heard to-day of the great german offensiveon the Somme ---*
Entry.149: It was very cloudy this morning and rained some during the day. heard to-day thatthe germans have got Albert back again ---*
Entry.150:
It rained a lot last night but was

a fine day. hear that we are likely to go into the line here again, just for a few days but on the right of where we last came out. this would be the front, we also hear that the germans are the other side of Albert and within 10M ofAmiens, also that our loses in war material have been great, and that the germans have captured anything from 47.000 to 60.000 prs
Entry.151: We expect to go back to the batt. to-morrow or the next day, as Tommys are taking over this front. we expect to go to the Somme, it was a lovely day.
Entry.152: It was cloudy to-day have heard nothing more of the battle on the Somme, but hear that some of our boys are down there and that the N.Zs took 450 prsand the french 700.
Entry.153: It was fine to-day. have heard nothing startling, only that we are likely to go to our batt any day now.
Entry.154:
It was cloudy to-day and rained some at different times during the day. we hear that we are going from here to-morrow

don't cock it up--*there are a lot of british troops here now. the batt so we hear moved from campto early this morning.

4.418 It rained a lot last night and some during the day we move not to-day but to-morrow.
Entry.155: We are now with the batt again. we came back a day before we expected the weather is still fine. Hear great roumours of the great german offensive.
Entry.156: Moved from the camp to-day and entrained for the south we had 12 hrs in trainand - arrived via -Bolougne and disentrainedat a place just near Amiens. fritz is shelling the latter place now what a difference to when we were here last.
Entry.157: Arrived here after about 6Mof a route march about 12 0.Cwe donot expect to be here long, in fact we are under 20M , it rained last night.
Entry.158: It was raining this morning, we are close up to the again expect to move up to the line again to-morrow, the arty fire was heavy last night, and has been so, off and on all day long -
Entry.159:
We have been so uncertain in our movements from this date too to-day that I have not found it quite convenient to make an entry each day, but up to to-day26.4.18,we have covered a lot of ground, we left this part for the Somme when the hunmade their advance there, we got out of the train at Amiens, this big place is being shelled a lot now especially at the Rail Station, we got nearly up to supports onwhich is now our front to the right of Albert or nearer Arras. we got a sudden order at mid-night, to be ready to move in 10 minutes, we then proceeded per boot for a couple of days, stopped in Amien for about 8 hrs and then entrained for the north again, we had just came from Belgium - fritz was making things lively while we were in it, we got out of the train this end and went battle oprder straight off the train, to take up a position, where we dug ourselves in by early morning, this was

about 250 yds on the outskirts of the village of . this we were told was the germans objective in this front, they attacked on the morning of the
Entry.160:
but got stopped, there were a few Ulans about too - our old billets at Sec Boisthat we were in last year, before we went up to Pascendaleare now under heavy shell fire, and are not far from the huns front line. Le Motte is but the huns hold part of the Le Motte forest otherwise Le Nieppeforces this is a large forest and has valuable timberon it, besides saw mills, it is about 60 sq miles in extent, the weather up to to-day has been cloudy, fritz were over the other night, and came awfully close to us, he dropped some bombs, we looked at the results of his work the following morning, some very big bombs were dropped, and some were unpleasantly close to a billetjust over the railylinefrom usthe shelling here (Borre) were we are now in hutsis sometimesclose, it is all heavy stuff, the batterys close handy account for this

The other night a very heavy bombardment opened up, it was just on our left, we were told after that the french, for they are joined up with us now, made an attack, it was sucessful and the barrage they putup was a big one, their 75sare a wonderful gunand play a great part for in preparing the way for the infintary, the french are stickerstheir is no doubt, and their hold out at Verdun must have been great, up to to-day I think there is nothing of very great importance that I have omitted, excepting that our turn in the line this time, was an extra success.
Entry.161: It was a fine morning but during the day it got cloudy and then - misty. we expect to go up again to the line to-morrow.
Entry.162: It was a fine morning, but during the day it became showery and came on heavy about ½ past 8 O'C to-night just as we were about to move up to the line, the bombardment on our left still continues heavy and the battle around Kemmelmust be a big one. the barriagegot to fire about 7 O'C and continued so for an hr. we go on a front to the left of where we were last in.
Entry.163: We got here about ½ past 11 O'C last night we are in an out post and at one point about 75 yds from fritz.
Entry.164: Still in out postit was cold during the day things are fairly quite therewerea good many of fritz aroplanes up to-day, one thing in our favour, the nights are short. this is a big item.
Entry.165: It was a cold night and is still cloudy it rained just a little last night, we expect to have a raid to-morrow.
Entry.166: It was a fine day, we are still in out-post, the arty fire has been constant, and there are fires all round us. Meteren is now a heap of ruins, our posts here are close to where we were billited not long ago, we expect to go out from here to-morrow night. got wounded early this morning and went away to-night---* the raid was cut out, some came close to our trench this evening fritz new fast gun, she is some gun.
Entry.167: It was a lovely morning, aroplanes are buisy and the shelling is fairly constant, we are shelling fritz - more than he is us, went to the other out post last night and to C.H.Q. we expect to move a good way back when we go out
Entry.168: We came out of the outpostlast night and are now in reserves. a big Hanley-Page came to grief last thing yesterday evening ---* these trenches are very shallow McG--gewas K early this morning
Entry.169: It rained this morning we were on fatigue last night we can get a good view from here of Meteren and Feletre Meteren is now nearly as bad as Stressele .
Entry.170: It rained last night. on fatigueagain, he is getting near this trench with his shells, some came awfully close, went M.O yesterday -
Entry.171: On fatigue again. last night down to BgdeH.Q.---* the shelling was quite last night, it came up very cloudy this morning and rained heavy from 5O'C to about 2 O'C this afternoon we expect to get relieved from here any day now ---*time)
Entry.172:
It turned out a fine day the arty fire on our left was extra heavy last night and still continues so, we got the pleasant news last night that we go up to the line again for another 4 days

instead of going out ---*
Entry.173: It was a lovely morning we go out to-night and not up again as expected, the day contained fine throout aroplanes buisy arty fire same as usual, we hear that we go to a place called Circus
Entry.174: We had a good tripout of the line the arty fire was quite , we are now in tents, got paid to-day we are not in quite as good a place as we expected
Entry.175: It was a fine day we did not do much to-day
Entry.176: It was a fine day we done a pde to day.
Entry.177: It was a fine day aroplanes were over last night and dropped bombs very close to us ---* went to football to-day near Circus third battbeat 4th 16 pts to Nil we hear that we are not likely to be out for as long as we expected
Entry.178: It was another fine day battalion sports were held to-day fritz was over last night.
Entry.179: Another fine day. things were quite fritz was over again last night Bdge sports are held tomorrow
Entry.180: It was a lovely day, we left here at 9 O'C for the sports via Wallon Cappel. the Brgde are at Sercus we went battle Order and found it quite warm the sports were a success, we got back to camp about 8 O'C
Entry.181: There was the usual pde to-day, but I went on M.G practice it was quite warm again no rations were issued--- *
Entry.182: We left the camp this morning, and got here after walking about 5K about 10 O'C this morning, we move from here to-morrow for the line fritz was over again.
Entry.183: It was a lovely morning we leave here for theline this evening, it turned out quite warm during the day. The aroplanes were quite buisy . Some stopped out ---* there was voulintary Church Pde held this morning.
Entry.184: We are now in outposts. got here about ½ past 11 O'C last night it is a lovely day. we are nearly touching our old front here, near Tressele villagewe are about 100 yds from the raily Stn. IveB--ly got hitonthe face with a piece of shrapnel last night first after we got here, as the results of some coming close, this part of the post is quite near the rail line.
Entry.185:
It was another fine day, and got quite hot during the day. we were on fat last night. fritz was shelling the raily Stn this morning with heavy stuff, and some dropped short he also got some direct shots

on the opposite, there was a big fire in Vaux Bierquin last night this is direct right from our post about 2 K's distance, we started on advanced post about 250 yds out from this one last night.
Entry.186: It was a warm day again, the arty fire was constant this morning he was shelling the rail stn again and the road and road and chateaus which are just at the back of us we went to find fritz last night, and found one of his out posts about 450 or 500 yds from ours, first salute we were halted then aM.G. opened on us, we had two W---* our arty fire was constant at intervals during the day fritz put over a barrage last night therewas a raid on our right, we went out after this about 1 O'C it was very bright, Sel--ns and Finely got W
Entry.187: It was fine to-day and got quite hot for a while during this afternoon on fat last nght. we expect to be relieved, early to-morrow morning
Entry.188: It was cloudy first thing this morning, and came on to rain about 5 O'C A.M. went out to the post again last night, bombs ---* we never got relieved as expected some shells came very close to us--yesterday, our arty fire was fairly constant during the night but the enemy was quite.
Entry.189: We are now in supports, came here last night about 12 O'C after a roundabout march ---* we are between 500 & 600 yds from the post we left, we expect to be here for 3 dys It was a lovely day, went for the last night, a couple were Wd after getting here, but not badly
Entry.190: Another fineday, went on fat to Bn H.Qlast night, a fritz was over usvery low to-day, the planes were lively to-day, ours especially we expect to get releived from here Supports to-morrow night, heard last night of another air raid on London and Paris also on Calais, hospitals ---* our planes brought down two of the enemy to-day one of the enemys machines was over us very low this morning ---*
Entry.191: It was another lovely day and got quite hot during the afternoon. there was a bombardment early this morning on the right and left of our sector - the aroplanes have been very buisy to day- was on fat last night Bn H.Q. rails ---*
Entry.192: We came out of supports early this morning went into reserves for a while---* then came on here our old billet just off the rail here, we nearly walked into a big shell ---*
Entry.193:
I have had nothing much to

record up till to day, some of of us went into Steenvordeon from the billet, and bame back to the billet after four days there fritz was shelling the town and a lot of the civilians had left it, we left the billetsnext day and came to this camp, this place is not far from Sercus and we are in tents, we have been having lovely weather, we expect to move from here soon, yesterday one of our captive balloons was brought down, the aeronauts got clear per the parachutes.
Entry.194: The weather up till this day before yesterday, was good but it came up cold & cloudy on the
Entry.195:
and rained very nearly the whole yesterday, to-day it is uncertain, last night it was cold and rained nearly all night, the nights now are very short it is twilight till about 10 O'C and gets daylight again at½past 2 O'C, I am now on the Coy C-'s, came on the day we moved up the line, I am with Geo we used to bestretcher bearers together a long while ago

according to all account our coy are having a hard time. this time, there are a few getting K some missing and a good many have gone away W and sick, this sickness is , and the symptoms are much the same as trench fever, they took part of an outpost from fritz the other night but it wasn't a success ---* the post was end on, & of course he is occupying one part of it, and our boys the other, things in consequence are lively. bombs etc--- Streezle now flatened to the ground and also is Meteren, Borreis just over the way from us as also is Predecles both these places are periocordallyshelled heavy, there has been great activity in the air up till the weather broke, they brought a hun plane down, who was trying to get one of our captive baloons, after driving him away from the baloon, and finally making him land, one of our planes went straight across and brought one of the fritz's balloons down in flames. We hear that there are now a lot of yankss out at the back of us, and then again we hear that the yanks are going to take over from us, then we go out for a spell
Entry.196: There has been a lot doing the last couple of days our backhas been cut about a bit. they went for an objective, at ½ past 12 O'C last night. we hear that things went well, but of course there was the usual casualties C-B. was K also L-dy and T-r and H-mhave died since. there have been a good many W and a lot away sick our Coyare now 96 strong up till last night, we do not know yet if they took Meteren yet, there were a lot of yanks up in our lines but, do not know yet if they went over the top, the barrage laid down was short, the huns havemade severalcounter attacks on our boys this time, so things have been lively the have been lively. we expect to get releivedto-morrow, the weather now is cloudy and cold, our casualties up to date must be 100 or more including 4,O K and 1W.
Entry.197: It was fine to-day, do not expect to come out of the line now till the
Entry.199:
It was cloudy to-day, aroplanes have been active, seen in the paper last night of the

great work the Italians have done, and were glad to hear about it, our casualties up to date have beenpretty heavy considering the ground gone over---*
Entry.200: It is now 5 days since we came out of the line, the weather has been good, to-day being extra warm, there has been nothing startling to record. was out for a walk the other evening and came across the graves of our own K last time in the line it is only just about 2Ksfrom here, we hear that we are likely to be moving again shortly, it does not seem as tho we are going to get much of a spell, the arty lately has been hot at times especially first thing of morning.
Entry.201:
There has not been much to record until just before we came out of the line 7 days ago when C-m and W-m were killed both were in my platoon: the weather for the last day or so has been dirty, and I'm afraid

it is going to be an early winter, we expect to be moving again about Tuesday. heard the day before yesterday of the greatPushby the french on the Somme. seen the paper to-day confirming with the roumour we heard the arty has been very active in this front lately we are now in tents on the outskirts of Hazebrouck about 1 Kilo from the main entrance to the town. We hear of an advance by our troops on this front and the fall of Meteren, Baillieuis also expected to fall, aroplanes have been buisy of late. Some of the
Entry.202:
B-n are W and K with bombs the other night at this is a little hamlet to the left of Boree & Pradelles, and not far from where we were the time before last when in the line heard to-day of the boat getting torpedoedthat wasbound for Australia with troops Joe -- was on the boat - they were lucky,for they were saved. this news came

came throper letter to Serg M-y. we expect to hear news yet of frances effort on the Somme, Geo - F-- ck was putin the g - d tent 4 dys ago for crossing the pde gnd do not know yet how he will , fritz's aircraft were very buisy this morning one plane especially was extra daring, it was fine first thing this morning for a few hrs then it became nastyweather and continued so for the remainder of the day
Entry.203:
It was fine this morning but came on to rain during the afternoon. Geo F--ck got 28 dys, we got 4 days ago. Rackenghem is the name of this place, we marched to here from near Hongenghem about 18 Kilos this place is about 11 Klos from St Omer. fritz was over last night and got very close to this place the bombs dropped first in the wheat field at the back of the billet! We expect to move again from here about tuesday. was into St Omer yesterday but the place is a lot quieter than it was. it has been bombed a lot, but is not being bombed now it is more on the outskirts the counter attack by the french

on the Reims - Soissonsfront has been a success, it has been one of the best moves for a long while Iwent on den-l this morning and had 4 out.
Entry.204: It was fine to-day hear that we move on tuesday I had four more teeth extracted to-day, had a letter from charles
Entry.205: Sports were held to-day And a march past G - l, P - r the day was fine had 3 more teeth out
Entry.206: It was showery to-day, we leave here this night, it is roumoured that we will be in action within 4 days down on the french front, Rheims, things are lively there at present, we entrain to-night at somewhere about St. Omeras far as we can gather
Entry.207: It is now some time since I made a record, and some great changes have taken place since then. we are now on the Somme and arrived here on the
Entry.208:
of this month and have been in action twice since then both big stunts, the first one we were in we advanced 13 miles and took a number of positionsincluding a number of villiages among some were Rozieresa big rail centre

This last attack we were in the advance was about 5000 yds but was continued in after we were relieved, the front here at presentis all on on the move, and the hun is getting knocked back everywhere. We are camped now just between and Morcourtthe first mentioned place was the scence of some heavy fighting, all these places including which is only about 4 kilos distant along with a number of other smaller places were in the hands of the hun a few days ago. in this last advance we made we captured a 15 in gun, it was an enormous thing and was on a turntable and well camouflaged--*this battalion in fact our coy took italong with the crew, it is the gun that the hun did use in Amiens, and we know what damage that could do for we got caught one time whenhe was shelling there - at first we thought we had got the Paris gun,
Entry.209: We had a swimming to-day the weather has been lovely, have heard nothing yet of a shifts,
Entry.210: It was fine, were on dental Pde this morning, could get nothing done.
Entry.211: It was cloudy to day, have heard nothing startling.
Entry.212:
We left Morecourt yesterday and arrived here Helles which village has just been left by the hun. Mont-Saint-Quientin is about half left from here distance one kilo & Peronne direct front distance about 1½ kilos. there was nothing startling to relate the last few days spent in the last camp we were in, we are now on the move and expect to go again this evening. We arrived here via Bray, Clery, Hem and after two hrs and a quarter in M.L. and three kilos of a march, things are active, and everything is moving forward some of the places we passed thro yesterday, have been flatened to the ground, there is in some cases just an odd gate post left standing. We hear that Peronne is full of dead, mostly huns, also Mont-Saint Quientin, of course there are sure to be others too.

Bray also took a lot of taking, but here the enemy did not put up the resistance he has done on this part of the front.
Entry.213: We left the out-skirts of Helles this morning we were in trenches here out of the village some little distance, we arrived here for dinner via Peronne after doing about 6½ kilos, we are in old huts here and are on a good ridge, the hun was preparing for the winter here, timber and newly made positions ---*front line of stop trenches. dead - out took on ridge ---* the name of this place is an old C.C.S it is a small forest, facing the line on our right is the village of Doingtand about 2ks distance half right from here is the village of Tancourt, the weather is choppy & it rained a good deal to-day.
Entry.214: It was choppy again to-day we travelled about 4M to-day & got here for dinner, we are level here with the Captive Balloons expect to move further to-morrow, are now within hearing of the big guns, fritz was over early this morning bombing but he did not stay long, we are now in an old camp near the villiage of Tincourt we are yet 7 kilos from the front
Entry.215: It rained a lot during the night. fritz went awfully close with some of his shells yesterday evening over the - we expect to go up this evening to supports. It was raining this morning first thing & is still raining 10.A.M.
Entry.216: The B-n moved up to the line @ 6 O'C yesterday evening, I went on Bgde T.P. yesterday after the B-n left, last night was a rought time ---* 39 of the 3rd D K & W near us ---* this is the troops our D relieved, our Bgde made an advance last night but came G-a . also again this morning it is reported the gained their Obj this time about a 1000 yds advance, but had to come out of it again, back to the old position, so suffered no doubt on account of this. we are in a very bad place here Hamelet. Was back via Hamel & Tincourt to Doingt this morning, with wagon and brought up the Y.M.C.A. Oh them guns, a few shells are now being sent over to fritz, and we are right under one of the guns 6 in
Entry.217:
It was a rough night rained a lot and was raining a lot this morning, we shifted from Hamelet yesterday evening

and are now camped in a small forest on the outskirts of Tincourt. Fritz shelled Roisel with big stuff yesterday, there is a roumour afloat to the effect that 3rd D to the number of 70 did M---* but wether there is any truth in it is another question, may find out later. the arty opened out last night and is still heavy.
Entry.218: It rained a lot last night and first thing this morning, but cleared up at times during the day, fritz sent over some big wonkerslast night and arty this morning, hear that the yanks have made a big push down south, and taken a lot of prisoners, we expect to hear of something doing on this front soon. arty is still active on both sides at times.
Entry.219: It was fine to-day our Bgde come out to-night, three fritz aroplanes where brought down last night, forty two out of this Bgde went to Aussie on leave this morning, among them C.P-tand big T.H-n out of the third -
Entry.220:
It was fine to-day, it is reported that there is a big stunt to come off in a day or two, to be carried out by the first D and it is also roumored that some

more go home to Ausie early in the coming week, we shifted back about a kilo yesterday evening but expect to be on the move again in a day or two, fritz was not over last night.
Entry.221: The hun was over last night, went over to the to-day, otherwise things were quite.
Entry.222: It rained a lot last night, and the hun was over but as far as we know did not do much with his bombs.
Entry.223: This morning a big bombardment opened out, it was an attack on a big front, and up to the present as far as we can gather it has been a big success, a lot of prs were taken, fritz was over last night, but dropped no bombs near us, all the bombing seemed to be around Peronne, which place would be an attraction ---* We hear that up to the present the advance is up to 8 kilos in depth, and on a big front
Entry.224: Fritz was over last night. T-O'N-L and P.- H-s came here last night from Peronne, Tom has been away about 8 wks and Patabout 3M's heard good news from the line last night, been in the paperthe news of the greatadvance on the Metzsector, by the Americans.
Entry.225: Last night was fine fritz was not over. It was a fine day, but was showery first thing, was up to Bgde, H.Q yesterday, the news in the paper this morning was good, an account of the advance on this front was given, the Americans are getting near Metz, which means they are near German soil, some more men for Aussieare going in a day or two. Heard that the battalions suffered pretty heavy this time in officers and N.C.O. Serg Nurr-y was W in this stunt. We expect to go out for a long spell.
Entry.226: It rained last night, our planes were very buisy until it got too rough, fritz was over for a time, our Bgde comes out to-night - the 1st Battalion came --- line last night ---* fritz sent a few big shells near the W.P. which is near the Rail Stn at Tincout, it is reported that 1915 men go after the 1914 class are cleaned up, which will not be long, this leave to Aus---a I expect will work out the same as blighty leave.
Entry.227:
It was very windy last night, and is the same to-day alltho no rain has come out of it so far, the batt came out into

reserves last night. We expect togoout in four days time and entrainfor Dieppewhich is down on thecoast our planes were buisylast night.Fritz dropped a few bombsbut they were a long way off. Oneofour plances came down this morningengine trouble.There were a good manyplanes about first thing this morning(mostly ours) but some of Fritzcameright across here ata very highaltitude.
Entry.228: It was cloudythrooutthe day,the Brits came out to-day. We expect to move any timenow. Fritz was over last night but didnot come handy. Re the
Entry.229: B-nandthe line ---* they went away to-day, itis roumoured for the -- C. I hearthat the batthad 82 C - s, but cannotfind out for certain yet. There areplenty of yanks around here, andtwo D - S of them releived twoD - Sof our boys. I hear that all the S.-- Bsare now nar poo in . Coy.
Entry.230:
We left near Tincourt fourdays ago, came along by roadabout 120 kilos via PeronneCoisy. Mont-Saint Quientin, Abbeville,Vignacourt, Long,Pont-de Remy wearrived here Epagne3 O'Cto-daywe passed throsome fine countryen-route, and had good weather

This is only a small village and is 12 kilos from Abbeville. We hear that we are only here for 5 dys. And then move on for Dieppe. We expect to be there for 3 or 4 mths. Have read the account of our great successes.
Entry.231: it was quiet to-day the weather continues good, hear that St Quentin & Cambari have fallen,seen in the paper rethe Balgantrouble. afinish up inthe Balkinsmight do a lot towards ending the whole buisiness. Turkey, ifBulgariacan arrange peace, would soon fall out too. This would I think end the Balkinstrouble & perhaps endthe whole war. We expect to hear good news within the next few days.
Entry.232: it was cloudy to-day. Heard of a big advance being made by the British on a front from Ypresto the coast.
Entry.233: It was cold to-day and rained atdifferent intervals. It is the Be-s that have advanced on the Ypresfront they have taken Paschendaleand Dixmunde. There was in to-days paper some good news re the bulgarian front.
Entry.234: It was fine to-day. More good news in the paper. Wentto Songlast night.
Entry.235:
it was a

lovely day, nothing startling to record, good news still comes every day with the paper.
Entry.236: It was fine to-day, we still got good news.
Entry.237: It was another fine day, we heard last night that Turkey had done the same as Bulgaria, but up to to-day have seen nothing about it in the paper, if things go on at the rate they are going at present, I fancy we shall not see the trenches any more, seen by the paper to-day that the Allies are now only 4Mls from Lille.great things have been done on the western front since July 18th.St Quientin is now only a skeleton, and Cambari is the same, we are still in the same town.
Entry.238: It was cloudy this morning, read in the paper of theproposal, by the centeral of Powers re Armistice.
Entry.239: It was fine first thing this morning but it became like rain as the day went on, nothing further of importance.
Entry.240:
It rained heavy during the night, and first thing this morning, we expect to hear



shortly of something startling in regard to the centeral powers - with a led off from Turkey, it fired up at intervals during the day.
Entry.241: It was fine this morning got into t--e ---*. I expect to go on Paris leave shortly. There was a pde for all hands this morning. Nothing else startling to record.
Entry.242: It was a fine day, expect to hear something startling from the front, it was during the evening, this was a surprise forduring the day it was fine. I do not expect to hear of much until a day or so.
Entry.243:
Within the last 9 dys there been nothing much to record, we have had two Bgde m- - past, the weather has been wet most of the time, to-day it is raining & was raining during the night. The war news of late as been good yesterday, the Allies according to paper are still pushing the hun out of the Country Lille fell the day before yesterday, when we first came to France re Lille ---* G--l B--d We are still in the same village

Up to the present we have not heard any rumours about a shift, had a letter from U.R. the day before yesterday. Some big route M have been done by the troops lately ---* full Pk . According to the news in the paper, I fancy that it is quite likely we shall not see active service, this is, go into action again, this is a great thing to look forward too and I think it is a general feeling throout the army.
Entry.244: It was cloudy to-day and wet and tacky under feet. I heard a rumour that we are likely to move from here within a day or two.
Entry.245: Readin the paper the good news re Austria. It has come at last, the weather excepting for an odd day or two has been good, there has been nothing of any importance to record lately, we are still in the same old billit
Entry.246:
This last few days we have had good news. We heard today that we move towards the line ----

on Tuesday, there have been a lot of S-- B--eares lately some in Abbiville and others in inthe latter places some were found in the river T--C---*they were supposed to be in B--y at the time ---* it is a hard thing to say but never the less it is only too true, this has all happened within the last day or so, the weather has been patchy and to-day it was very cloudy, with an odd shower or two. I expect to see within a fortnight's time the downfallof the centeral powers, it is not certain yet wether we travel per rail or road, and some say our desternation is Lille and others have it that it will be Cambari. We are still in the same villiage Epagne.
Entry.247: It was raning to-day. We expect to move to-morrow heard yesterday of the fall of Austria
Entry.248:
It was another wet day our move was posponed for twenty four hrs, so we move to-morrow morning, we heard for the forward area, we expect to go to either Tincourt or Roziel there places must be now between

twenty and thirty miles behind the firing line. I did not expect to go near the firing line again, we were promised a spell, three months at the least, we have not been out half that time, it is only a matter of days thoI think and Germany herself shall give in. We expect to go by train to morrow from Pont-Remy, which is about 2 kilos from here.
Entry.249: We arrived at Tincourt early this morning, things are much the same as they were when we left here, but of course, there are neither shells nor bombs to contend with. it was a hot corner when we left here.
Entry.250:
Great things have happened since I last made an entry, we have been here some days now, about eight if I remember right we are in the villiage of Busigny and expect to leave here in the morning, for Germany, we came from Tincourt, by road via Bellicourt thro LeCatelet, there was some heavy fighting done at the first mentioned place, this is where the great system of tunnels were, and constituted a very strong part of the

Hindenburg line the germans made a great stand, but were beaten out of it after heavy fighting the villiageitself, is shelled to the ground, Le Catelet is a big place, but is not knocked down near so much, as villiages I have seen. The last days travelling we finished up, at a villiage called Bazuel, which is about 3 kilos from Le Cateau this last place we come thro, it is a big place, and a lot of civillians were come back to it ---*all these places were at the time bedecked with flags, and a lot of the places we came tho were flying the white flag, this was on certain buildings, to tell the Alliesin there advance of the occupation by civilians this was to guard against shelling etc ---* We stopped 2 days at Bazuel then came to this place via road, it is only about 15 kilos, there are a lot of civilians in all the villiages now and we expect to find even forward, hard to get a place to stop in. I made a little tour round while we were at Bazuel there is a railway runthro Bazuel, and a stn here ---*
Entry.251: We left Basigny this morning and came via St Souplet to Mazingheim we stopped here for the night after coming about 12 kilos, bombs have been dropped a lot here ---*
Entry.252: We left Mazinghein this morning and came via Catillon, which is a big place, there was some heavy fighting done about this town, the civilians are coming back along the roads with hand carts etc, making back I suppose to their homes, we also came thro La Groise, and on to the next villiage Prisceles which is a big place, we stopped here for the night.
Entry.253: we left early this morning and arrived here Fleaumont for a late dinner after doing about 18 kilos we came thro Cartignies, and Aveznes , these are both big places, we came on to Fleaumont and stop here for the night the weather has been good.
Entry.254: We did not travel to day, but expect to move from here to-morrow, this morning down on the railway shells ---* and horses ---* there is also a roumour afloat that we do not go to Germany.
Entry.255: We left to-day about 9 O'C it was raining we came about 7½ Ms the name of this place were we are now is Soriel-le-Cheatau it is a fairly big place, we are stopping here with civillians - the husband was telling us about the hun O's and the R&F re Cinemashows ---* we were told back at Freincourt by a farmer there who up till the evacuation by the hun started, was at Colonge since 1914, the people here, who's room we now occupy (three of us) have also had a hard time, the husband had been in a batt & he tells us that the hun had them working near the line on different occasions. we expect to be here about ten days.
Entry.256: It was very foggy to-day, got T.G rm, from T.M. the people here tell us that tobacco was 75 frcs a lb and we seen some sugar they bought about 1 1/3 lb's which cost 9 frcs, these are fabulious prices.
Entry.257: It was another cloudy and damp day, we hear that we are likely not to go to Germany, now, went with M.O. to sawmill, seen M.S.P. destroyedeverywhere, and went into farm for word ---* Par bon (Madam) I asked her if the wood belonged to the hun ---* work, very big woman
Entry.258: It was a wet day, rained all day, and still continues, nothing startling to record, we heard to-day from the people here, re Aussie prisoners chained ---*
Entry.259: It was fine today, that is not raining, altho cloudy. We heard now that we entrain at Namour this is a big town, we go direct from there to Germany.
Entry.260: It was fine today, nothing startling to report.
Entry.261: It was a lovely day went to millfor wood, and heard that there is a war on again between Japan & Russia, some of the boys left for A-a to-day early 1915 went. I expect to be away now by the end of the year.
Entry.262: It was very cold to-day went again to the old German saw mill - expect to move from here next Friday.
Entry.263: It was a very cold day, went again this morning to the old G--nS. Mill & to the forest during the afternoon it was bitterly cold all day
Entry.264:
It was raining first thing this morning & continued damp thro the day. There is a roumour afloat that we are now likely to stop here for another fourteen days

one hundred odd joined the 3rd batt upyesterday, including newmen and some details
Entry.265: It was very foggy this morning but turned out a fine day. We had a Bgde T.P. muster today expect to move tomorrow, find it very hard to get a newspaper here
Entry.266: It was a lovely day - hearnow that we leave here on the 9th that will be Monday next, a lot are awaiting Blighty leave yet some thirteen months men yet, it does seem rotten that this should be. especially as this stage of the game ---*
Entry.267: It was cloudy today,some of the 3rd batt went away to- day to Blighty, Horseferry Rd, so I'm informedfor jobs 1915men
Entry.268: It was another lovely day, we hear now that we are likely to be here until the 15th of this month.
Entry.269: It wasraining early this morning and continued wet thruout the day, we wentto the A.S.C. this morning, cannot get a paper off any description here now,
Entry.270: It was very wet today. things are very quite in this place, went again to the P.S. upin the church. nothing much, barthe clodhopper
Entry.271: It was very wet today and was raining. we are told hereby the people that we are stopping with, that in the early days of the War fritz had bands playing continually, in operating theatres and in the square of the town here, this was to attract patiens attention, while operations were being performed, this we are told was on the account of the shortage of morphine, Chloroform other pain relieving antitotes -
Entry.272: It was again another wet day. Heard today that the Government ofAussie, might close on the G.W.B. onaccount of the poor response by the public of Aussiein supplying the 7th war loan, All June men expect to be away from france within another week or so.
Entry.273: It was very wet first thing this morning, but did not rain much during the day
Entry.274: It was fine todayweleave this place tomorrow,----
Entry.275: We left Sorel de Chateau this morning and after travelling 15 Kilos we arrived here.Stopped in the Chateau, it was very cold and rained off and on all day plenty of mud
Entry.276: After doing about 25 ks to-day we arrived here it is a very small place, we done about 8 Kls extra I went as far as THYle Chateau andhad to come back to this place as it was raining a good deal during the day and very muddy ---
Entry.277: We arrived here Gougnies early to-day, the place we are in here is not much, we expect to be here for six weeks, and perhaps longer, we are 5 Kilos from Charleroi, it is a nice part of the country and under different conditions, one would enjoy the change ---*
Entry.278: It was very wet and cold to-day winter is settling in, in earnest now.
Entry.279: It was very wet when we first got up this morning but cleared up during theday at different times.
Entry.280: It was another wet day, got hand hurt today
Entry.281: It was showery to day, went viaGougnies where the 1st Batt are for rations
Entry.282: It was cloudy to day with occasional showers
Entry.283: It was very rough to day, we have electriclights in our rooms and a C. fire
Entry.284:
It was a lovely day.





but it was cold, went to the dump to day for rations
Entry.285: It was cold this morning, and some snow fell during the night, but it was light. Wehad Xmas dinner in vacant building opposite the Chateau. It was about 3 O'C when it come on, it was a lot better than lst year --*
Entry.286: It was fine today, heard that the 1915 men all are going home shortly, by the end of the year, there was no sports or anything of the kind on to day the troops are all getting anxious to get home.
Entry.287:
It was very cold today went for rations today, expect to get snow tonight.

28.12.18 It was another cold and rough day. there is a roumour going the rounds that the 1915 men shall be away by the 8th of next month that is
Entry.288: I cannot get a paper of any description now, not even Anzac Bulletin.
Entry.289: It was another rough day, nothing startling to write about.
Entry.290: It fine today but was cold at times.
Entry.291:
It was not so cold today, Our rat--s since we have been here have not been the best, br---d is a good issue, but j--m and de--b--ur have been very conspicuous by its absence, it is about up to us to get a fair go re this ---*
so ended the year of 1918
Entry.292: The New Year has started with fine weather, there is nothing startling to record, as far as we were concerned we passed off very quietly.
Entry.293: It was very cold today went for rat - nstoday, the rat - ns now arejust the neat thing and butter seems to be cut right out hear that the 1915 men go away on the 7th of this month,
Entry.294:
It was fine today, do not get much news here, cannot get a paper, and as regards anthing concerning the peace propaganda, we are ignorant - trust soon to be on my way to Aussie.

8.1.19 The weatherthis last few days, has been lovely & today, it was perfect, the 3rd Bn beat the 1st today on the
Entry.295: Bn ground, it was a fast game the scores were
Entry.296: – 15 pts to 6 pts, Some of the 1915 men go away from here tomorrow morning at 4 O'C. We seen a paper tonight for a wonder.
Entry.297: It was very rough, and rained a good deal during the day, the men that were to go early this morning did not go, as the order was cancelled late last night, they are to go tomorrow morning, So we are told,
Entry.298: It was fine today, the men due for Aussie did not not this morning, But are to go Sunday
Entry.299:
It was cold today, expect soon to go to England, we are told that snow has fallen very heavy in Scotland, We have had none so far, worth speaking off -

18.1 The last few days has been fine, but today it rained all day. I expect to go via England for Aussie in the morning, Punch died last night, he was all thro the war, while we have been in France
Entry.300: It was very cold this morning, the boys went away in four horse G.8 wagon, I did not go, for reasons that I cannot account for, I was up to 6 months, as regards service ahead of any that went away this morning, There is another lot goes within 9 or 10 days time - I do not expect to be home for Easter now, It snowed slightly yesterday evening
Entry.301: It was a lovely day, there is nothing - starling to report, only that the next batch leave for Australia on the
Entry.302: of this month. I should be among this lot
Entry.303: It was a lovely day, hear of melee among our troops and the at Namur--* Something of the sort also happened, I hear at Amiens--*
Entry.304: It started snowing early this morning but did not last long.
Entry.305: It was fine today there is nothing startling to report.
Entry.306: It was cold this morning I set out for Chatelet, but fairly on the outskirts of Gugnies I met with an accident, limber ---*
Entry.307: It started snowing first thing this morning and continued till about 12 o'c, there is now about 3 inches of snow, this is the heaviest so far this yearthat we have experienced
Entry.308: It snowed some more – during the night
Entry.309: The snow is finished and it is fine today, do not hear anything about another draft, that, was to hed outfor Aussie in the morning, there is nothing, of any interest worth recording
Entry.310: It was cold today, go to Brussels in the morning, for three days, do not expect to go to Aussie now untill the 8th of next month.
Entry.311: It was finethis morning, but heard of nothing startling, I arrived in Brussels to-day, I was very foggy 'Waterloo' 'no Bonn --* Duke Wellington --*
Entry.312: It does behove me too collect my thoughts recording anything here is / as I've said It is to me' That is to say. I dont wish to write. Today itwas a very cold day I think I shall find a comrade before long. My first days' B - lls leavewasnt as I expected to find it, so endedthe first of a series ofthree or four days.
Entry.313: It was snowing this morning, went with guide to various places of interest including , among which were Palais de Justice, this is a wonderful building. I also went thro the Cathe- which is a big place, also, museum and art gallery --* and the Bankque of France, Kings * I arrived home, via Charleios, and Chatelet at ½ past6 O'C. Brup – is a lovely city but sight seeing would be better in the summer and just now things are very dear --* 1½ frs
